result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. BONNIE E SOMMERS

records.addlTxt: Return date on February 7, 2023 at 10:00 am.

2:55 PM Defendant BONNIE E SOMMERS appeared by phone.  Attorney Blake Duren appeared by video for BONNIE E SOMMERS.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Atty Duren states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Duren. Attorney Duren acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Duren stands mute. Court enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on February 7, 2023 at 10:00 AM. Court instructs the defendant that Atty Duren is court appointed and reminds her that she is to make her payments.

Court adjourned at 2:58 PM

Defendant called Clerk of Courts and requested to appear via Zoom telephone for hearing at 2:15 p.m. today, as she is still recovery from surgery.  Zoom telephone instructions were given to defendant and she was instructed to let her attorney know she will be appearing via Zoom.  Defendant confirmed mailing address on file is correct.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on October 25, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Letter to the defendant dated 08/18/2022 re: Court appoints Atty Blake Duren. Defendant is to pay $100.00 per month for court appointed attorney fees and is to commence August 15, 2022, which is now past due.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Blake Duren)

Defendant phoned the office to inquire on the status of Court appointed counsel, as she was instructed to do at the 07/18/2022 hearing. She was informed that we are searching for counsel and will hopefully have an attorney appointed soon. She was told that she could call back in a day or two to receive an update.
Petition for Appointment of Attorney
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant BONNIE E SOMMERS in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has provided the petition for court appointed counsel. Court questions defendant if she can pay $100 per month for court appointed attorney fees. Court orders defendant to pay $100 per month commencing August 15, 2022. Court will appoint counsel. Court goes over defendant's address. If defendant does not hear anything in 30 days, defendant is to contact the Clerk of Court office.
Second appearance on July 18, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

3:22 PM Defendant BONNIE E SOMMERS appeared by phone.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by defendant, has filled out the petition for court appointed counsel and called this morning and was hoping to fax the form to the court. Court sets for Status of Counsel on July 18, 2022 at 3:45 PM. Mandatory appearance.

Court adjourned at 3:23 PM
Call from defendant indicating she has no way to get to court - does not have a vehicle or a ride.  Provided Zoom instructions to defendant.

2:00 PM Defendant BONNIE E SOMMERS appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Michael Kapelis in court via zoom. Defendant can hear the court. Court quashes the warrant. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court informs Atty Kapelis that defendant has received a copy of the complaint and went over the penalties. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond and standard conditions. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Prelim on June 7, 2022 at 4:00 PM.

Court adjourned at 2:03 PM
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Warrant to GLSO on 05/16/2022.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
